title._content: Photograph of 5 year old Willie (William Frederick Tear, 490 Louisiana Ave.) one of Washington's youngest news-boys, 04/16/1912

description._content: Original Caption: Photograph of 5 year old Willie (William Frederick Tear, 490 Louisiana Ave.) one of Washington's youngest news-boys. He is a kind of free-lance, helps other boys out, and roams around the city on his little velocipede, with all the recklessness of extreme youth. Gets lost occasionally. He was so immature that he couldn't talk plain, and yet he was pretty keen about striking people for nickels., 04/16/1912 U.S. National Archives’ Local Identifier: NWL-233-PACCBILL-63AD5-5 ARC ID: 306618 Photographer: Hine, Lewis Created By: U.S. House of Representatives. (03/04/1789 - ) From: Record Group/Collection: 233 From: Papers Accompanying Specific Bills and Resolutions of the 63rd Congress Committee on the District of Columbia, 04/07/1913 - 03/03/1915 Series Dates: 1913-1915 Production Dates: 04/16/1912 Persistent URL: arcweb.archives.gov/arc/action/ExternalIdSearch?id=306618 Repository Contact Information: Center for Legislative Archives (NWL), National Archives Building Reproductions may be ordered via an independent vendor. NARA maintains a list of vendors at www.archives.gov/research/order/vendors-photos-maps-dc.html Access Restrictions: Unrestricted Use Restrictions: Unrestricted
